column1: Why was 8 afraid of 7? because 7 was a registered 6 offender
column3: The word six refers initially to the number, and in the context of the joke, it has a double meaning implying sex in ‘registered sex offender’.
column4: Six is the number that comes after five in the sequence of natural numbers.
column5: The six of them went to the park together.

column1: What do you call a pair of crows? an attempted murder.
column3: The word murder refers to a group of crows, while in a legal sense, it denotes the act of unlawfully killing someone.
column4: The murder of the innocent man shocked the entire community.
column5: The naturalists were thrilled to witness a murder of crows in the field.

column1: I plan to retire at 30. the used tire business is just calling my name.
column3: The word tire refers to the rubber covering on a wheel, while it can also mean to become fatigued or exhausted.
column4: I need to buy a new tire for my car before my trip.
column5: After running the marathon, I really started to tire and needed to rest.

column1: What do frogs say? times fun when youre having flies.
column3: The word flies refers to the insects that frogs eat, while it can also mean the act of moving swiftly in air (time flies).
column4: The flies buzzed around the picnic, attracting all the insects.
column5: Time really does fly when youre having fun.
